prs.title: Split the block cache into block pointer cache and block data cache
prs.truncated_body:
Split the block cache into block pointer cache and block data cache

- Introduce new block_pointers table to keep hash, number, parent_hash, timestamp
- Remove columns number, parent_hash from old block cache table 
- Cache truncation now removes all the block data but not the pointers.

commits.message: use psql information_schema to check for migration requirements

prs.title: feat: light client get cached merkle tree
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes:
1. rename trait `RpcConnection` -> `Rpc`
2. rename `RpcConnectionConfig` ->  `RpcConfig`
3. rename `SolanaRpcConnection`  -> `LightClient`
4. rename `SolanaRpcUrl` -> `RpcUrl`
5. add `pack_tree_accounts` method to `ValidityProofWithContext` see counter example for usage
6. add `get_output_tree_index` method if V1 tree pack Merkle tree, if V2 tree pack output queue.
7. feat cach

commits.message:
feat: add Merkle tree getters

refactor: rename RpcConnection -> Rpc

refactor: rename SolanaRpcConnection -> LightClient, rename RpcConnection -> Rpc

rename: SolanaRpcUrl -> RpcUrl

fix: make PhotonIndexer flexible for non local host

feat: add ValidityProofWithContext::pack_merkle_tree_accounts

refactor: pack_merkle_tree_accounts add pack output indices

fix: use TreeType in test-utils

fix: lint

fix: counter example assert

chore: set LightProgramTest address Merkle tree to amt1Ayt45jfbdw5YSo7iz6WZxUmnZsQTYXy82hVwyC2

refactor: light-sdk rename merkle_context -> tree_info, use PackedTreeInfo which contains root_index instead of PackedMerkleContext, rename PackedMerkleTreeAccounts -> PackedTreeAccounts and return one output_tree_index
refactor: split get_compressed_account into two add get_compressed_account_by_hash
chore: add log_failed_tx option, log all tx with debug asserts
test: add program-test indexer trait test
chore: move light-client test to program-tests
refactor: rename account_trees -> state_trees, get_output_tree_index -> pack_output_tree_index

prs.title: Utilize child error transactions in web3
prs.truncated_body: This PR makes changes to utilize child transaction errors in web3 modularized flow. There are cases where we have CONTRACT_REVERT_EXECUTED with no message or detail in the parent transaction but the real reason it failed in services is present in the child transactions. Added unique statuses to childTransactionErrors list and propagate them to GenericResponse. There is a case where the parent tran

commits.message:
utilizing child transaction errors in logs and generic response

Signed-off-by: filev94 <todor.filev@limechain.tech>

modifying childTransactionErrors to store status instead of errorMessage

Signed-off-by: filev94 <todor.filev@limechain.tech>

prs.title: Chatbot
prs.truncated_body:
A quick demo for an AI chatbot in Incongitee using ChatGPT 

Motivation: enhance privacy when using AI

features:
* pay-per-use anonymous payment for each prompt. keeps context within the same conversation (each Incognitee account can have one conversation for now)
* caveat: as neither ChatGPT nor our chatbot service are private, both Integritee and OpenAi can see plaintext prompts and respo

commits.message: add entire conversation history as context
